results.title: Bright eyes
results.creator_credit: David Butler, Sol Wurtzel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Shirley Temple collection”.
The first big film created especially for her, ‘Bright eyes’ helped make Shirley Temple a huge box-office star and features her most famous song, ‘On the good ship Lollipop’. The little darling of a group of aviators, Shirley splits her time between her pilot Godfather, Loop and her long-suffering mother who is a housemaid for a selfish, wealthy family. When a tragic accident suddenly leaves Shirley orphaned, Loop sets out to adopt Shirley - until he learns that he is not the only one determined to keep the adorable youngster. This is a colourized version of the original black and white film.

results.title: Hello Dolly (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gene Kelly, Ernest Lehman, Chenault and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Barbra Streisand is a knockout as Dolly Levi, the woman “who arranges things… like furniture and daffodils and lives”. The plot concerns Dolly, a young widow and professional matchmaker who sets her sights and whatever else she can muster, on conquering tight-fisted Yonkers merchant, Horace Vandergelder, beautifully played by Walter Matthau. How she does it has to be the grandest musical there ever was! So, spend a magical evening with the incomparable Barbra and enjoy a great musicals. Also stars Michael Crawford.

results.title: Home alone (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Chris Columbus, John Hughes and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is one of the most successful comedies of the eighties and stars pint-sized hero Macaulay Culkin. In a chaotic frenzy to get to the airport on time, the McCallister family forget one thing - eight year old Kevin. When two bungling burglars attempt to break into the McCallister household, Kevin is left home alone to defend himself and his house. He outwits the burglars by waging war the only way he knows how. A John Hughes film co-starring Joe Pesci, “Home alone” is a modern-day classic.

results.title: Heidi
results.creator_credit: Allan Dwan, Darryl F. Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Shirley Temple collection”.
Shirley Temple portrays the spirited young heroine of Johanna Spyri’s popular children’s novel giving her rich emotion and infinte charm. When her Aunt tires of caring for her, orphan Heidi is taken to the Swiss mountains to live with her gruff grandfather (Jean Hersholt), a hermit who comes to adore her. However, the Aunt returns to steal Heidi and sells her to a family whose invalid daughter (Marcia Mae Jones) needs a companion. Bullied by an evil governess (Mary Nash), Heidi still charms the entire household and never stops trying to return to her beloved grandfather. Colourised version.

results.title: Gentlemen prefer blondes (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Sol Siegel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Two showgirls go to Paris in search of rich husbands in this musical comedy which is memorable for the score and songs such as “Diamonds are a girl’s best friend” Starring Marilyn Monroe, Jane Russel and Charles Coburn. Based on the novel by Anita Loos.

results.title: Sommersby
results.creator_credit: Jon Amiel, Arnon Milchan, Alcor Films, Regency Enterprises and Studio Canal+
results.brief_description: People remembered Jack Sommersby as a bitter, loutish man but when he returns home after the Civil War, he’s tender, caring and resourceful. Has the war changed him… or is the man calling himself Jack Sommersby an impostor? Richard Gere and Jodie Foster are a match for the ages in Sommersby, a period romance rich in mystery, detail and splendid performances. They portray Jack and Laurel Sommersby, whose love grows as the suspicions about Jack mount. If he isn’t the man she married, Laurel knows he is the man she always wanted, but an ultimate test of their love and Jack’s identity awaits. Jack must stand trial for his life and the outcome makes for a memorable film.

results.title: Free Willy
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, Jennie Lew-Tugend, Lauren Shuler, Alcor Films, Regency Enterprises and Studio Canal+
results.brief_description: This is a heart warming and touching story about the friendship that develops between an abandoned child living in a foster home and an Orca (Killer Whale) who is confined in a too-small tank at Pacific Northwest aquatic park. At night Willy cries out to his family who frolic in the nearby bay. No-one can undestand his cries and moods - no one except Jesse (Jason James Richter) a 12 year old boy who knows what it is like to be without a family.

results.title: This boy's life
results.creator_credit: Michael Caton-Jones, Art Linson, Odyssey, Regency Enterprises and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: This is the captivating true story based on the book by Tobias Wolff. Growing up is never easy but for Tobias Wolff (Leonardo DiCaprio) it’s sheer hell. His mother, Caroline (Ellen Barkin), has just married Dwight Hansen (Robert De Niro), a psychotic disciplinarian who rules with an iron fist and an explosive temper. Instead of the bright future his mother promised him, Tobias must now endure constant brutality from his sadistic stepfather. There is a way out though; and with the will to fight and courage way beyond his years, Tobias just might find it. An absorbing and thoughtful story is brought to life by the gripping performances of the stars.

results.title: Captain Blood
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Cosmopolitan and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Peter Blood, a young doctor unjustly condemned for treating rebels is sentenced to slavery. Arabella, the beautiful niece of a cruel plantation owner, buys him, but Blood and his mates eventually escape and begin a career of piracy, gallantly fighting off adversaries on the high seas. After a strange twist of fate, Arabella and Blood meet again and justice and romance prevail. This film, with its thrilling sea battles launched the careers of Errol Flynn and Olivia de Havilland in the title roles.

results.title: Wittgenstein
results.creator_credit: Derek Jarman, Tariq Ali, Bandung Prod, British Film Institute and Channel 4 Television
results.brief_description: Ludwig Wittgenstein was born in Vienna in 1889 and he was to develop some of the most important twentieth century work on the philosophy of language and meaning. Jarman’s experimental biography is highly theatrical, interspersing biography, soliliquies, lavish fantasy and dream sequences. The film traces Wittgenstein’s life through World War I; his career as a school-teacher and eventually as an academic at Cambridge University; to his final abandonment of classical philosophy and the development of a challenging deconstruction of language which was to bring him in conflict with more positivist philosophies. Scripted by renowned English academic, Prof. Terry Eagleton, the film revolves around a series of arguments and discussions between Wittgenstein, Betrand Russell and their academic peers. This intelligent film links abstract discourse to the politics of everyday life. In the long run, Wittgenstein’s break with the hierarchy at Cambridge is not only a product of intellectual speculation but rooted in his problematic and alienated homosexuality which could not find direct expression in the higly austere and conventional environment of “high academia”. Though this film demands rigorous attention it is also a highly stylised and beautiful exercise in the possibilities of experimental cinema. With Tilda Swinton.
